etymology.description: 卜(卜) (bǔ, "divination") + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") = speaking about divination -> divination
etymology.interpretation: The character 占(占) (zhān, "divination") represents the act of divination, combining the symbol for divination itself with the mouth, which may imply speaking or chanting during the divinatory practice.

examples.chinese: 古人借占(古人借占)，测定吉凶(測定吉凶)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ rén jiè zhān, cè dìng jí xiōng.
examples.english: Ancient people used divination to determine auspiciousness and inauspiciousness.

examples.chinese: 他占了一卦(他占了一卦)。
他运用占(他運用占)，预测未来(預測未來)。
examples.english: He relied on divination to predict the future.
